front.p: 1882 July 13: to Gore Museum of New Zealand—Te Papa Tongarewa MU000094/006/0209

body.p: Thanks many for your kind note of the 6th., and for 3 copies of “Trans”. vol. xiv. which came with it. I am writing to Dr. Hector, and so enclose this. I often think that I give you a deal of trouble,—more perhaps than any other unfort. Hony. Secy. of all your many branches! but, I cannot help it: I am shoved on by others,—just as the foremost fellow in a London mob! (Do you happen to know anything practically of this?—I do.) Even now I am writing to Dr. Hector for 5 more copies of xiv! it seems that there are lots of enquirers this way for those papers re the old Maoris. Please let me know, how many more copies you may be able to spare me—even if to be paid for: also, of vol. xiii.—
Don’t be very much vexed with me for the trouble I am giving you.
If you should require a receipt for those last 3 copies, I will send it together with that for the 5 copies now written for. W.C.
